intro: Sticherus paulistanus, commonly known as the Brazilian starwort, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
